definition: lit. as sweet as syrup (idiom, from Book of Songs); to endure hardship gladly/a glutton for punishment
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
as/as if/such as
maltose syrup

sentences.english: How did ya' know I'd give my heart gladly?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么知道我甘之如饴地将我的心献给你的？

sentences.english: It seems austere but he enjoys it very much, never feeling insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 看似清苦，可是他甘之如饴，从不觉得还缺少什么。

sentences.english: Nancy, if you were my wife I'd drink it.
sentences.chinese: 南茜，你要是我夫人，就是毒咖啡我也甘之如饴。

definition: to take pleasure in sth (idiom)
no complaints/to have no regrets
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
to be willing/to be satisfied
to enjoy sth and never tire of it (idiom)
willingly and gladly (idiom)
willingly
to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
to have a clear conscience/to have no qualms about sth
bear hardship with equanimity/regard wrongdoing with equanimity
deeply attached/devoted
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
engraved in one's heart and carved in one's bones (idiom); to remember a benefactor as long as one lives/undying gratitude
pain/suffering
